intro: Hieracium bornetii, commonly known as the Bornet's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Hieracium bornetii is often found in open, sunny habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
